title: service_cpm = sum( service_instance_cpm )  ?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ ] Question or discussion
___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
excuse me.
does service_cpm = sum( service_instance_cpm )  ?
in my case, service_cpm !=  sum( service_instance_cpm ) .
author: klmzfyf

comments.body:
Generally, they should match, but if the traffic is too little, it could mismatch.
The real matching thing is traffic_count(not set in OAL, but logically you can). 

CPM = calls / duration.
Such as in hour-level metrics, you at least need 60 calls per hour could have 1 CPM.

title: A question about MetricsPersistentWorker context map
author: andyzzl

comments.body:
>  a metrics object which not stored in context is considered as a new metrics, otherwise, it needs to be combined with the old metrics in context

This is not a correct conclusion. Read `#loadFromStorage`, `context#put` is called if metrics could be loaded from database.
Sorry I didn't make it clear. I mean after `loadFromStorage` called, if a metrics can't be found in `context` still,  it is a new metrics.

> Sorry I didn't make it clear. I mean after `loadFromStorage` called, if a metrics can't be found in `context` still, it is a new metrics.

Why it isn't?  It means you need to insert it into the database, rather than updating.
After prepareRequests generated, we can put it into context, both db and context are updated. So we don’t need to query db in next run.

That depends on the context. I deleted a comment about this.

Thinking about this, if your service includes parameterized URI, such as `/prod/{id}/create`, but you don't always have grouping rules, or SpringMVC(even you have, there is Gateway before your Spring controller codes), then every request could create different endpoints. All these endpoints have one access but cost memory for nearly 1 minute.(context only has an expired period).
Considering this, do you still want to add this logic?

If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: xiangwangcheng

comments.body:
@xiangwangcheng for `role` and `RoleBinding`, if you don't enable Envoy ALS (or you don't know what Envoy ALS is), you can safely delete it, at this time, it takes no effect at all so leaving them there does no harm.

But SkyWalking OAP needs a service account, hence you cannot delete `oap-serviceaccount.yaml`

title: [javaagent] agent.sample_n_per_3_secs config stands for TraceSegment?
body:
Dear skywalking team.
As I read skywalking agent code, **agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** this config stands for upper limit of TraceSegment, is it right?
As one TraceSegment can hold many spans, just suppose 1 TraceSegment has 3 spans, 
if **agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** set to 150, then the upper limit of spans has been 450.
Is it right?
author: lijial

comments.body: Yes, but span doesn't matter for SkyWalking, especially at the storage level.

@wu-sheng 
>Yes, but span doesn't matter for SkyWalking, especially at the storage level.


**agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** config cannot measure network flow accuracy
Even **agent.sample_n_per_3_secs** is numeric small , but the whole network flow could be numeric big. 
The more spans, the high network flow.
So I would think agent.config need a new config **agent.spans_n_per_3_secs**

Network flow means from javaagent trace data to collector, As high network flow would influence app.jar
Read the document, there is a config called `SPAN_LIMIT_PER_SEGMENT` to do this. But less spans could break your traces, do the client side tracing is not working because of this.

___
### Bug

- What happened?
If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: justforstudy-A

comments.body: Ignore yours or ignore all tracing of the Kafka plugin?

> Ignore yours or ignore all tracing of the Kafka plugin?

Just for the plugin of  mine,not for all tracing
No, there is no such mechanism. Tracing means tracing all related. You can't partial OFF, because they are the same at the instrumentation level. The plugin can't tell who is using it.

for example:

1、official document 
Count. In the period window, if the number of values over threshold(by OP), reaches count, alarm should send

2、official alarm-setting.yml
  service_sla_rule:
    # Metrics value need to be long, double or int
    metrics-name: service_sla
    op: "<"
    threshold: 8000
    # The length of time to evaluate the metrics
    period: 10
    # How many times after the metrics match the condition, will trigger alarm
    count: 2
    # How many times of checks, the alarm keeps silence after alarm triggered, default as same as period.
    silence-period: 3
    message: **Successful rate of service {name} is lower than 80% in 2 minutes of last 10 minutes**

___
### Bug

If possible, provide a way to reproduce the error. e.g. demo application, component version.

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Please describe your requirements or improvement suggestions.
author: killGC

comments.body:
Consider the period is a moving window caching the metrics. Every minute is a slot in the window. 
Alarm core checks the window every minute. Count means the minimal count of value in the slot over threshold.

title: Application will not quit after main() done
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
Here is the example, assume that we have a class `Hello` as defined here

```java
public class Hello {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello, World!");
    }
}
```

after doing this

```bash
 java -javaagent:skywalking-agent.jar Hello
```
we should got `Hello, World!` at terminal stdout, and then the application should quit with status code `0` (which means process quit without any errors)

However, what I got is:
1. the stdout is ok
2. the application KEEPS RUNNING until I trigger `CTRL-C`.  

Maybe it's a normal circumstance when some non-daemon background threads are still running, but it's still quite a wired phenomenon where the application has done it's work and keeps running without any response for common developer.

From my point of view, as an agent, all threads should be daemon? @wu-sheng

title: Is 6.6 oap cluster can receive  trace from 6.5 Agent ？
body:
### Question
- What do you want to know?
Is 6.6 oap cluster can receive  trace from 6.5 Agent .
I update my cluster from 6.5 to 6.6. But  some agent is 6.5 。
The oap clusters  can run . But some trace is bad. Service can not show right name ,It it show VNode....
author: seifeHu

comments.body:
I don't think that is related to 6.5->6.6. It is compatible, and agent should be able hot reboot if you erase all data int the storage.

I am not sure what do you mean bad. VNode is a UI enhancement to tell you, some part of the traces has not been reported.

title: Whether Java agent supports fetching exception stack trace?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?
- [ x ] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [ ] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- What do you want to know?
Whether Java agent supports fetching exception stack trace?
___
author: long187

comments.body:
No I haven't. 
Sometimes, developers catch exceptions, but they don't print them to the log. Can SkyWalking Java Agent catch these Exceptions?

If they catched, there is nothing we could do. Instrumenting exception is not a good idea, if you were thinking about this. This should be inside the coding style scope, can't be taken care of by the APM system.

Are you using the 6.3.0+ agent? The reboot doesn't exist before that.

I am sure my version is 6.3.0. agents won't re-register after "OutOfMemoryError" occurred in server, and I couldn't see the "cool down" in the logs. It still doent's re-register so far.   I am going to give it a try for the 6.4.0 version observing whether or not it still have the same problem.
What do you expect after `OutOfMemoryError`? This is hard to say. Re-register is not for this case.

The situation is when "OutOfMemoryError" occurred, I rebooted the server. I expect agents can re-gister by themselves without rebooting them, but it didn't work. maybe in "OutOfMemoryError" situation, re-register is not support. Am i meaning right?
That is no `re-register`, that should be called as `reconnect`, because you are talking about gRPC level connection. This has an issue in 6.3.0, YES. We have fixed it in 6.4.0 release.

title: [BUG] Can not locate agent jar file
body:
when i use grpc register service find a problem，in my project add pom
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.skywalking</groupId>
    <artifactId>apm-agent-core</artifactId>
    <version>6.1.0</version>
</dependency>
and apm-agent-core.jar in WEB-INF/lib/
use main func run GRPCChannelManager connect success
but build my project as war in tomcat run connect fair  
error:Can not locate agent jar file
i found AgentPackagePath.findPath use ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader.getResource get URL
in my project return null so get error:Can not locate agent jar file
i change this code to 
URL resource = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader().getResource(classResourcePath); 
if (resource == null) {
   resource = AgentPackagePath.class.getClassLoader().getResource(classResourcePath); 
}
in tomcat run connect success
but i am not sure this way is the best  can your give me some suggest
author: zou79189747

comments.body: Don't put agent.jar or any other SkyWalking plugin jars in your classpath. SkyWalking loads them automatically.

我这边的场景是全链路分析，有C写的网关，有java写的微服务，java微服务那快没什么问题直接-javaagent就可以了，但是C这边我们的方案是 通过一个掉用一个java后台提过的http接口来注册服务， 该接口调用skywalking grpc 来注册服务，提过java接口的后台是一个web工程，且在tomcat catalin.bat里面没有使用-javaagent ，这个场景下我就引用了apm-agent-core这个依赖，调用doServiceRegister注册服务，然后在tomcat环境下 报Can not locate agent jar file这个错，调试发现URL resource = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader().getResource(classResourcePath); resource为null ,想请问一下这个场景我修改源码有问题吗，还是有其他更好的方式解决
English only. I have said what is the issue. `-javaagent` is also needed in Tomcat, and don't put agent in Tomcat lib or your application lib, a.k.a. not in any classpath of JVM.

> thanks ! as you said do , it is ok now. but this way i have to use skywalking in my web project , this data is not needed

What do you mean `data is not needed`? Confusing.

I don't need use skywalking to monitor the web project , if add -javaagent in tomcat  , it will send my web project monitor data to ES , like Service 、ServiceInstance 、segment , this datas is no use to me.
I am totally lost. If you don't need, why add SkyWalking there? Why ask a question in SkyWalking community?

I use SkyWalking in other Microservices ，In this web project just provide restful Interface to Third party，help them  register service 、serviceInstance  and send trace segment to skywalking storage ，this web project it's not must be monitor

The same question, if you don't need it, just don't attach the agent to JVM.

Are you asking severl web apps in one Tomcat container? Some are monitoring targets, others are not? I am just guessing because you don't give me a very clear context.

Is there any document for upgrade?
here is my upgrade procedure for upgrading from 6.0.0-beta to 6.0.0-GA(it may not be the best practice)
1: stop all backend servers
2: delete all old indexes of sw(you can delete all indexes that starting with the value of storage.elasticsearch.nameSpace)
3: upgrade all backend servers
4: upgrade all agent and restart all application that start with javaagent (I used sw for java app)
5: start all backend servers

comments.body: No service discovery in 6.x. Are you using 5.x agent to connect 6's backend?
Yes, the version of the agent I use is 5.x. Is it normal after upgrading to 6.x?

title: Some questions about the agent collecting data
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.

- Why do you submit this issue?

- [x] Question or discussion
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Requirement
- [x] Feature or performance improvement

___
### Question
- How often does the agent report data to the collector?Can it be configured?（探针发送数据的时间间隔是多少？是否能配置？）
- How big is the agent buffer setting? Can it be configured?（探针收集的数据缓存设置了多大？是否能配置？）

___
### Requirement or improvement
- Can you provide a custom collection strategy? Can do special requests will be collected。（能否提供自定义收集策略，可以做到指定特殊请求都会收集）

thank
author: cyejing

comments.body:
> How often does the agent report data to the collector? Can it be configured?

Consume per 20 ms. See `TraceSegmentServiceClient#L69`. We use DataCarrier's default settings. It is not open now.

> How big is the agent buffer setting? Can it be configured?

See `org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.conf.Config#Buffer`. Default channelSize * bufferSize. You could set anything in Config through `agent.config`

This helped me.
Consume per 20 ms. I think this is a problem. if 20ms have a lot of data into DataCarrier . datacarrier will be discarded data . datacarrier buffer strategy is `BufferStrategy.IF_POSSIBLE`. 
How improve？
How many traces do you intend to add into the buffer in 20ms cycle? I am confusing.

# alarm threshold

    applicationErrorRateThreshold: 10.00

protected Object doInvoke(Object... args) throws Exception {

			String text = (ex.getMessage() != null ? ex.getMessage() : "Illegal argument");
			throw new IllegalStateException(getInvocationErrorMessage(text, args), ex);
		}
		catch (InvocationTargetException ex) {
			// Unwrap for HandlerExceptionResolvers ...
			Throwable targetException = ex.getTargetException();
			if (targetException instanceof RuntimeException) {

			}
			else if (targetException instanceof Error) {

title: druid + mysql：compatibility problem?
author: neeuq

comments.body: 是的，你可以尝试一下3.2.3版本，我们已经不再替换Connection.

更新了代码，这个应该没问题了，发现代码结构有些变动。补充个问题：
1、是基于什么考虑，把jdbc监控修改了
2、插件包现在放在外面了，是方便增减，都实际部署时感觉集成至一个jar包更方便，纠结了

> 1、是基于什么考虑，把jdbc监控修改了

主要解决的是这种连接校验的问题。除了Druid之外，有些datasource也监测这个。

> 2、插件包现在放在外面了，是方便增减，都实际部署时感觉集成至一个jar包更方便，纠结了

这个我个人认为，增减是主要特性，你只是多了一个`tar`的操作，我觉得没有必要纠结。

另外，因为此问题已解决，我将关闭此问题。

title: Tomcat8 + spring mvc：one http request create on span?
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.
### What version of sky-walking are you using?
最新版本

### What did you do?
技术点：tomcat8 + spring mvc
可能是我不太理解设计思路，一个http请求只会产生一个span，而不是tomcat 8和spring controller在各自的切面产生各自的span。虽各自类都能正常拦截，但引用的是同一个span，是不是同一个线程的关系吗？
author: neeuq

comments.body: 一次调用中，tomcat8和springmvc都属于EntrySpan，所以会进行自动合并。这是我们的一个性能优化策略。
